title: Formation of SiC by Magnesium-Thermal Synthesis
content: SiC is a ceramic material with remarkable properties such as corrosion resistance, wear resistance, high strength and high hardness, as well as excellent high temperature properties like oxidation resistance, high thermal conductivity and a low thermal expansion coefficient [1]. The synthesis of SiC has been approached by different methods as microwave, detonation, calcination, pyrolysis, solvothermal, carbothermal reduction between some others the synthesis generally implies the use of furnace that require to reach temperature of at least 1000 C and hold those high temperatures for at least an hour which is a costly approach, here we suggest a novel method for the synthesis of SiC [2].
